property.name: text
property.value:
The continuous plant models two generators 1 and 2 with a common frequeny and with a relative phase between generators 1 and 2 as indicated by the parameters. The plant is modeled using a continuous director.
The voltage outputs of these generators are measured by two independent platforms 1 and 2. The platform 2 microprocessor chip also contains the sampling AtoD converter and the real-time clock. For platform 1 the AtoD converter and real-time clock are contained in an FPGA on the same platform as the microprocessor. In each case the Ptolemy system requires that there be special actors in the continuous domain to convert input and outputs from a discrete event domain. Thus the two rectangles indicating the components included in each platform slightly overlap the continuous plant model to cover these conversion components. Of course in code generation the entire platform model would be on the platform with nothing except a connection to the plant.
The time plotter displays the measured outputs of the two generators.
The discrete clock and the connected components are required to ensure that the simulation advances. This is due to a current issue with composite actors, such as the platform models that contain a source (in this case a discrete clock) with no dependence on an input to force local time to advance.

property.name: text
property.value: This plant model consists of two generators with frequency and phase determined by the parameters. The outputs are modeled by the samplers which are driven by signals from the respective measurement platforms. Normally in an actual system these samplers will be on the measurement platform rather than in the plant and with an analog connection between plant and measurement platform. However the Ptolemy system requires that these components be included in the continuous domaing rather than in the discrete domains of the two measurement platforms. The rectangles indicate those components that actually are part of the measurement platform.

property.name: text
property.value: This composite models the microprocessor of a measurement platform where the A to D converter and real-time clock are on a separate FPGA chip. The single event actor generates the sampling rate sent to the transducer FPGA to configure the sampling clock in that platform.
